Sports at AECOM
The Rise of the Temporary Venue
In an era for mega sporting events when legacy is paramount, the long-term fate of any venue is under scrutiny. Temporary venues are an increasingly common piece of the legacy planning picture. What are the options? What the comparative advantages and disadvantages? And what does it mean for the sports industry?
Read the Article »
Steve Burrows on a changing industry Stadium engineer and leader of AECOM?s building engineering practice in the Americas, Steve Burrows talks about what the modern design industry can learn from history, what it means to be an engineer and what type of solutions the city of the future will require.
Case Study: Urban Game Changer As architect of the JELD-WEN Field renovation in Portland, Oregon, AECOM created an electric atmosphere for Major League Soccer in the heart of the city. The transformed stadium invites the public into its plazas and fans onto the pitch, connects to transportation and strengthens a vibrant downtown community.
Rio 2016 Following London's example, Rio positions the 2016 Games to transform its future. The Olympic Masterplan hosts the games within a landscape that will serve as foundation to a flourishing metropolis. See the vision played out in this video.
